description: Your role would be either part-time or full-time CRM Application Management & Development for an app we wrote and are piloting. The CRM is one of a dozen apps we've created for repair shops. You duties will include; 1. Oversee the daily management of the Marketing CRM application. 2. Collaborate with our marketing agency and agency clients to identify and prioritize new features and enhancements for the application. 3. Report and document bugs, software issues, and enhancement requests in Jira. 4, Maintain the issues list in Jira, ensuring proper prioritization of bugs and features for sprint releases. Testing & Quality Assurance 5. Perform final testing on new features and bug fixes to ensure the application functions as intended. 6. Provide feedback to the development team to address usability and technical issues before deployment. Client Training & Support 7. Partner with the app support and training team to ensure all Marketing & Reputation Manager clients are effectively trained on application features and updates. 8. Offer guidance to clients in creating and managing manual and automated email and text campaigns within the application. Communication & Collaboration 9. Act as a central point of communication between internal teams, and clients. 10. Ensure alignment of application development with client needs and business goals. It's a wonderful team and a hot new app suite. Posted by Bill Kilpatrick for Jeff Wrigley
title: CRM Project Manager (Automotive Repair)

description: Title: Virtual Assistant with Expertise in Bookkeeping and Data Management/Administrative Assistant Description: I am seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented virtual assistant to support me in my role as a hospital administrator for a 24-hour emergency veterinary hospital in Fresno, California. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on taking direction, improving efficiency, and managing multiple responsibilities with precision. Responsibilities: 1. Bookkeeping & Financial Management • Enter bills into QuickBooks and assist with setting up auto-pay systems. • Perform monthly reconciliations and cleanup of existing accounts. • Support automation of financial processes by integrating data from our practice management software (Cornerstone) into QuickBooks. 2. Data Management & Reporting • Extract and analyze data from Cornerstone veterinary software to generate actionable insights. • Compare and reconcile datasets using advanced Excel skills. • Create and manage custom reports, queries, and data visualizations as needed. 3. Administrative Support • Coordinate schedules, send correspondence, and follow up on monthly statements. • Manage workflows efficiently and ensure timely completion of recurring tasks. Requirements: • Strong proficiency in QuickBooks and Excel (including advanced functions like VLOOKUP, pivot tables, and macros). • Experience with bookkeeping, reconciliation, and financial process improvement. • Ability to learn and optimize systems such as Cornerstone veterinary software. • Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail. • Proactive, reliable, and comfortable working independently while taking clear direction. Preferred: • Familiarity with veterinary practice management software or similar systems. • Experience improving or automating workflows and processes. Schedule & Hours: This role is flexible and can start part-time, with the potential to expand as we develop a workflow. Ideal for someone who enjoys repetitive tasks once processes are established but is also open to helping refine and improve those systems. Compensation: Dependent on experience and skill level, but competitive for the role.
title: Administrative assistant/bookkeeper

Responsibilities Training and Onboarding Develop and deliver customized training sessions for employees at all levels, focusing on operational use and best practices. Provide ongoing support to ensure users are comfortable and proficient with the system. Process Optimization Analyze current business processes and recommend improvements aligned with JobBOSS² capabilities. Ensure the system setup supports efficiency, compliance, and scalability.
title: Contract Consultant for ECI JobBOSS² Implementation and Training

description: POSITION SUMMARY FitOn Health (https://www.fitonhealth.com) is seeking a part-time QA (with an opportunity to be hired full-time) who can help with our software testing initiatives ensuring that our FitOn Health products meet the highest standards of quality and reliability. This position requires a deep understanding of both automated and manual testing, as well as a proactive approach to identifying and solving quality-related issues. Must be based in the United States. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES * Design, develop, and execute detailed test plans and test cases based on thorough requirements analysis. * Identify, document, and track defects, working closely with the development team to facilitate resolutions. * Analyze system specifications to ensure tests are feasible and aligned with business needs. * Enhance and maintain our automation frameworks, improving scale and coverage of automated tests. * Execute both manual and automated tests as required, with QA evidence attached. * Report on key quality metrics to project stakeholders, including defect densities and open defect counts. * Collaborate with product management and development teams to integrate QA processes with continuous integration and deployment pipelines. * Other duties as assigned KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND OTHER QUALIFICATIONS * 5+ years of experience in software quality assurance. Experience in the Healthcare industry is strongly preferred. * Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes. * Experience with automated testing tools * Familiarity with SaaS products and cloud technology. * Stays motivated and is detail-oriented * Is self-directed and can work remotely with minimal guidance
title: Part-time QA for a Health & Fitness Startup

description: We are a small e-learning design and development agency looking for an individual freelance instructional designer (ID) to work with on an on-going basis in 2025. Work will be on a per-project basis, and hours will vary from week to week, however we have many long-term ongoing projects at present and also in the queue for 2025. The ID will work with our internal team, our client's SMEs and internal teams to outline, script and storyboard e-learning modules that will be built in Articulate Rise and/or Storyline, as well as on workbooks for instructor-led training and other instructional support materials that align to our client's internal standards and branding. In terms of workload, project hours will vary at times, but will typically be anywhere from 5-20hrs. per week per project. Projects will be on-going throughout 2025, and our goal is to have an ID selected and ready to start the week of January 6th, 2025. Compensation is $40/hr. (minus UW's fees), and each project will have a maximum hours cap that all ID work must be completed within (this varies by project). Strong knowledge of, and proficiency with, instructional design, adult learning principles, excellent writing/editing skills, adherence to writing style guides, outlining, storyboarding, working effectively with SME(s), project/time management skills, responsive communication and the ability to adhere to deadlines is necessary to be successful in this role. Adherence to accessibility guidelines and standards is also required for these projects, so any familiarity with those aspects is a plus, however we can also train you on some of these aspects if needed. In terms of software, you should be proficient with current versions of MS Word and have a basic level of familiarity with MS Teams. Familiarity with Asana is a plus, but not required. Finally, you will be required to sign a non-disclosure agreement (NDA) as this is required by our clients. If you meet the requirements above, have the necessary availability, and would like to work as part of a skilled team, we invite you to apply. This is steady ID project work for the right person(s) that will extend through the next year and possibly beyond.
title: Instructional Designer Needed for Ongoing Projects

Ability to work independently and manage time effectively. Compensation: - Pay is per appointment set. - Additional incentives based on successful demo conversions. If you’re motivated, reliable, and excited to help potential clients experience our innovative software, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Quickbooks for small company

description: We have need of a accounting professional (CPA) to perform tax advising, state and federal filing preparation, and filing for a small, unique healthcare provider organization with 3.2m gross revenue. We have a full charge bookkeeper, and only need tax advising, filing preparation, and filing support. Your role would be primarily interfacing with executive leadership and our outsourced bookkeeper for necessary financial reports and information required for tax advising, forms preparation, and filing requirements. Successful performance in this role may lead to a fractional CFO role. We use QuickBooks Online Pro as our accounting system. We also use other web based systems for remote communications and document storage and sharing: Dropbox, Teams, Office 365, etc. So familiarity with these and the ability to utilize and leverage technology to proactively communicate and maintain strong virtual connections to support and satisfy business processes is absolutely required. The entity that needs support, a California C-Corp, but was converted from a 501c6 Corporation in 2023, was formed in 2014 through an alliance with other individuals in our niche industry. The industry organization's mission was to provide infrastructure and deal flow to its members. It was initially funded through the purchase of one of the founding members for profit business assets, which had been in business for over 15 years. The purchase of assets from the for profit was conducted via a seller financed asset purchase agreement and note. The note was not paid, and in 2023 the sole remaining member (the original founding member who sold the for profit assets to the non-profit) decided to reorganize as a for profit to comply with IRS rules as it had to begin providing services directly to customers, instead of via its members. The reorganization, settlement & assignment agreement was conducted by our outside counsel, Ryan Woods, Esq., and filed with and accepted by the California Secretary of State. However, the organization's prior accountant failed to properly designate its 2022 990 filing as "final", so when counsel filed the IRS "reclassification" request, the IRS returned it as unprocessed, and the 2023 returns, although prepared, were not able to be filed as a for profit with the IRS. As such, the first task of the new accountancy should be to make the necessary amendments to the filed 990 return(s), work with counsel to obtain for profit reclassification by the IRS, then review and correct (if required) the drafted 2023 returns, and then file them. The organization, The National Phlebotomy Provider Network, Inc. operates in multiple metro markets in several states and specializes in medical and research specimen collection, processing and delivery services for a variety of customer constituencies. The company is both a B2C and a B2B venture with a very diverse customer constituency. The company utilizes a PEO employment model through ADP, so employer tax liabilities are managed by ADP. Preferred experience: -Management of company tax reporting and filing obligations to relevant state and federal agencies -Computer skills and utilization of Microsoft applications for documentation -Absolute reliability, fast communication, and a demonstrably proactive work ethic are required -Detail Oriented & Strong organizational skills -Reliable & Trustworthy and a Strong Work ethic -Expert knowledge of for profit and non-profit tax matters, and ability to interact with and communicate with company executive leadership, legal counsel (as needed), and state and federal tax agencies and authorities, as needed. -Good listening skills -Maintain Confidentiality & Data privacy -Ability to prioritize appropriately and meet deadlines with little to no supervision Please provide an estimate of hours needed to support the about and your rate. Please feel free to submit questions, if needed. Thank you
title: Accountant Professional Needed for Small Healthcare Support Business

description: About Us: As we scale our team and operations, we need to ensure that our HR infrastructure is built on a solid foundation of compliance, efficiency, and strategic alignment. We are seeking an experienced HR Management Consultant with deep knowledge of U.S. employment regulations, HR best practices, and tax-related compliance to help us establish and refine our HR management structure. Key Responsibilities: HR Structure Design & Implementation: 1. Develop a comprehensive HR framework aligned with industry best practices and U.S. employment laws. 2. Advise on and create policies, procedures, and workflows for hiring, onboarding, performance management, and offboarding. Regulatory Compliance & Documentation: 1. Ensure all HR-related policies comply with federal, state, and local regulations. 2. Identify and prepare all necessary HR documentation (e.g., employee handbooks, offer letters, nondisclosure agreements, and other standard employment forms). Employment & Tax Requirements: 1. Provide guidance on all tax-related aspects of employment, including payroll taxes, state employment taxes, and any required filings. 2. Assist in setting up systems and processes to manage withholdings, benefits administration, and compliance reporting. HR Technology & SharePoint Integration: 1. Help set up and organize an HR SharePoint site or similar platform for centralized documentation, compliance records, and employee information. 2. Recommend and integrate HR software tools that streamline recruiting, onboarding, and compliance tracking. Strategic Guidance & Best Practices: 1. Offer expert-level insights into competitive compensation structures, benefits packages, and incentive plans. 2. Advise on best practices and initiatives that strengthen our company culture. Qualifications: 1. Extensive experience (5+ years) in HR management, HR consulting, or a similar role within the U.S. 2. Proven track record of building HR infrastructure in startups or rapidly scaling companies preferred. Knowledge Areas: 1. In-depth understanding of U.S. employment law, labor regulations, and HR compliance requirements. 2. Comprehensive knowledge of federal and state tax rules related to employment, benefits, and payroll administration. 3. Familiarity with HRIS/HRMS tools and SharePoint (or similar platforms) for documentation and record-keeping. Technical & Soft Skills: 1. Strong organizational and project management skills, capable of delivering clear processes and documentation under tight timelines. 2. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, ensuring that complex HR and legal concepts are easily understood by internal stakeholders. 3. Attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in compliance documents, contracts, and tax filings. Why Join Us? 1. Shape the foundational HR structure of a high-growth AI startup. 2. Collaborate with a forward-thinking team focused on innovation and efficiency.
title: HR Management Consultant

description: About Us: We are looking for a part-time Certified Public Accountant (CPA) to manage our accounting operations, ensure tax and regulatory compliance, and maintain accurate equity and financial records. Key Responsibilities: Equity Accounting and Compliance: 1. Properly account for investment shares and equity issuance. 2. Maintain accurate and up-to-date capitalization tables. 3. Handle necessary filings, including issuing 1099 forms and EC documents. Accounting Systems Integration: 1. Ensure our accounting processes are seamlessly integrated with payment platforms like Stripe. 2. Handle a high volume of daily transactions efficiently and accurately. Tax Compliance and Filings: 1. Oversee all tax withholdings and ensure timely and accurate tax filings. 2. Stay current with U.S. tax regulations related to equity, investments, and corporate transactions. 3. Guarantee no filings are missed during tax seasons or equity sales. Detailed Financial Oversight: 1. Support the preparation of underlying data for pro forma projections. 2. Provide technical accounting support, ensuring financial records comply with U.S. GAAP and relevant regulations. Regulatory Expertise: 1. Remain updated on U.S. financial, tax, and regulatory changes. 2. Advise the company on compliance best practices and make proactive recommendations to address potential financial challenges. Qualifications: Professional Certification: Active CPA license required. Experience: 1. Proven track record in accounting roles focused on compliance, tax filings, and regulatory adherence. 2. Experience with equity accounting, cap table management, and complex financial transactions. Technical Skills: 1. Proficiency in accounting software and systems integrations. 2. Comprehensive knowledge of U.S. tax laws and regulations. Soft Skills: 1. Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring high-quality financial reporting. 2. Strong organizational and time-management skills. 3. Ability to work independently in a dynamic startup environment. Why Join Us? Contribute to a cutting-edge AI startup shaping the future of technology. Opportunity to influence financial compliance at a pivotal stage of growth.
title: Part-time CPA

description: Project Description: We are an emerging real estate investment firm focused on creating distressed funds for single-family and small multifamily properties in Texas' triplex areas. We are looking for an experienced Property Acquisition Profitability Consultant to evaluate the profitability of residential property acquisitions across various strategies, including: - Fix-and-flip - Rentals - BRRRR (Buy, Rehab, Rent, Refinance, Repeat) - Arbitrage opportunities - New construction projects - Land and Development The successful candidate will need to have experience in Real Estate (Residential and S/M Size Multi Family Properties): - Comprehensive financial models and ROI projections. - Clear insights into profitability for each strategy. - Detailed recommendations tailored to accredited investors. Advanced experience in real estate financing, including debt analysis through private or hard money lending, market analysis, and investor presentations, is essential and a bonus to have familiarity with Texas real estate markets in areas such as Houston, Dallas, Austin, San Antonio, and Corpus Christi. This project requires proficiency in financial modeling tools and data analysis software. Candidates with a real estate investing or property portfolio management background will be given top priority. Additionally: - Clear Deliverables: Sensitive project timeline reports, interactive tools, and charts are needed. - Ongoing Opportunity: Long-term collaboration could be considered after three months if the existing project is successful and has limited delays. - Tech Requirements: Proficient in software tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or advanced Excel for data visualization, along with the capability to upload analysis reports to our company website. - Texas-Specific Expertise: Highlight the need for knowledge of Texas markets specifically in the Tri-plex area such as Houston, Dallas, and Austin but could also include San Antonio, and Corpus Christi.
title: Property Acquisition Profitability Consultant I ***Residential Real Estate***

description: Videographer - Las Vegas Location:Venetian Hotel Duration: Saturday, December 14th 10am-12pm (2hrs) plus travel, set up and breakdown time Company Description: Qualia Life Sciences is a leading organization in the field of biohacking, dedicated to promoting advancements in human performance and wellness. We seek a talented and experienced videographer to join our team for a few hours and help capture interviews with a top biohackers, doctors and wellness experts. Job Description: As a videographer, you will be crucial in capturing and producing high-quality video content showcasing an interview from a high profile individual. Your primary responsibilities will include: Filming: Utilize your technical expertise to capture footage of the interview. Pay close attention to sound quality, lighting, and composition during the interviews. Equipment and Set-up: Bring your own professional video equipment, including cameras, microphones, lighting equipment, and any additional gear required for the job. Set up and adjust equipment as needed to ensure optimal results in various shooting environments. Post-production: Edit and post-process the footage to create captivating videos that effectively sell the Qualia products. Enhance audio quality, trim clips, and apply color correction to ensure a polished final product. Collaboration: Work closely with our marketing team to understand their vision and goals for the videos. Coordinate with other team members, including photographers and event organizers, to ensure a seamless workflow and consistent branding. Requirements: Demonstrated experience as a professional videographer, preferably with a portfolio showcasing previous work in event coverage and interviews. Proficiency in operating professional video equipment, including cameras, microphones, lighting setups, and related accessories. Strong technical knowledge of videography principles, including composition, lighting, sound recording, and post-production techniques. Ability to capture high-quality video footage and record clear audio in different environments. Proficient in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or similar tools. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact professionally with influencer and team members. Strong attention to detail and the ability to work under tight deadlines without compromising the quality of work. A self-starter with a creative mindset and a passion for storytelling through video. Application Instructions: To apply for the position of Videographer please submit the following: Updated resume highlighting your relevant experience and skills. Portfolio or reel showcasing your previous videography work, with an emphasis on event coverage and interviews. Confirm availability. Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further consideration. We look forward to reviewing your application and working with you to create compelling video content. Christopher–shoot raw color vs Color correct Shot gun mic Lav mic Cannon dslr r5 zoom lense :45 min interview Based in 9:30am James Type of camera Color correct?baked in color - Can you take photos? $450 Color $100 for color correction
title: Videographer - Las Vegas, NV

description: Job Overview: We are seeking an experienced macOS developer with expertise in system-level programming, user input monitoring, and automation to develop a desktop application. The app will record, store, and playback user interactions (keyboard and mouse actions) for experimentation, automation, or testing purposes. This is a freelance position requiring advanced macOS development skills and a strong understanding of system-level programming while ensuring compliance with Apple’s security and privacy guidelines. Responsibilities: • Develop a macOS application capable of recording and replaying user actions (keyboard/mouse). • Leverage Quartz Event Services (CGEventTap) to capture and monitor low-level system input events. • Implement Apple Accessibility APIs (AX Framework) for UI monitoring and interaction control. • Build precise playback algorithms for reproducing recorded actions with accurate timing. • Optimize the app’s performance using Grand Central Dispatch (GCD) and multithreading techniques. • Securely store logged actions in a database using Core Data or SQLite. • Ensure compliance with macOS sandboxing, TCC (Transparency, Consent, and Control), and other Apple security requirements. • Provide user-friendly features such as visual feedback, automation scripting integration (e.g., AppleScript or Automator), and robust UI/UX design. • Debug and troubleshoot issues using Xcode Instruments and macOS profiling tools. • Document the app’s architecture, usage, and permissions to ensure transparency and ease of maintenance. Required Skills and Experience: • Advanced macOS Development: Expert in Swift and Objective-C, with experience in building robust, user-facing macOS applications. • System-Level Programming: Proven experience working with macOS Core OS APIs, CGEventTap, and HID Framework for low-level input capture. • Automation Expertise: Familiarity with integrating automation tools, including AppleScript, Automator, or custom scripting engines. • Playback Algorithm Design: Strong knowledge of implementing precise timing and sequencing for input playback. • Database Management: Proficiency in managing logged data with Core Data or SQLite. • Security and Privacy Compliance: In-depth understanding of macOS sandboxing, hardened runtime, and user consent frameworks (TCC). • Debugging and Optimization: Advanced debugging skills using Instruments and expertise in optimizing application performance. • UI/UX Design: Ability to create intuitive interfaces for monitoring, managing, and replaying recorded actions. • Ethical Compliance: Understanding of global privacy laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and Apple’s App Store guidelines. Preferred Skills: • Experience with machine learning for predictive modeling to optimize automation playback. • Familiarity with reverse engineering tools (e.g., Hopper, IDA Pro) for advanced debugging or experimentation. • Knowledge of kernel extensions (kexts) or System Extensions (though not required). • Networking skills for integrating cloud-based features to sync or share recorded actions. Deliverables: 1. A fully functional macOS desktop application capable of recording, storing, and replaying user actions. 2. Secure database for storing input logs and playback settings. 3. Intuitive UI/UX for managing the recorded actions and automation settings. 4. Documentation of system architecture, app features, and compliance measures. Project Duration and Compensation: • Duration: Estimated 6-8 weeks for the initial version, with potential for ongoing enhancements. • Compensation: Competitive rates based on experience and deliverables. Open to hourly or milestone-based payment structures. Application Requirements: • Portfolio showcasing relevant macOS applications or similar system-level projects. • Detailed resume highlighting experience with CGEventTap, AX Framework, and other relevant technologies. • Brief proposal outlining your approach to this project, including tools and technologies you plan to use. Join us in developing an innovative application that blends advanced macOS development with cutting-edge automation!
title: Advanced macOS Developer for User Interaction Recording and Playback App

description: Job Description: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Remote Call Specialist to join our Roman Media Group team. In this role, you will be instrumental in conducting two key types of phone calls aimed at identifying key decision-makers and setting appointments to support our client's business development efforts. Responsibilities: • Prequalification Calls: o Conduct initial calls to targeted companies to identify and confirm the gatekeeper's name and the decision-maker's contact details. o Accurately document and update this information in our CRM system. o Build rapport with gatekeepers to gather valuable information that can assist in future communications. • Follow-Up Calls: o Execute follow-up calls based on a previous touchpoint, such as a handwritten card sent to the decision-maker. o Discuss the contents of the card to reaffirm the recipient's recollection and express our intent to build a professional relationship. o Aim to secure a specific time and date for a meeting between our client’s managing partner and the decision-maker. o Schedule appointments directly into our client’s calendar, ensuring all details are accurate and confirmations are sent promptly. Requirements: • Proven experience in telemarketing, sales, or a similar phone-based role. • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage effectively over the phone. • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. • Proficiency in using CRM software and calendar management tools. • Ability to work independently in a remote setting. • High school diploma or equivalent; further education or certification in sales or marketing would be an advantage. What We Offer: • A fully remote position allowing you to work from home. • Competitive hourly pay. • Flexible working hours tailored to peak business hours and target time zones. • Comprehensive training and ongoing support to ensure success in your role. • Opportunities for career advancement within a growing company. How to Apply: If you are a driven individual with a knack for communication and a passion for achieving results, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for this role.
title: Job Title: Remote Call Specialist

description: We are a small one employee LLC. Actually two small LLC’s. I am looking for a consultation on developing a plan for book keeping going forward based on our circumstances We have an existing bookkeeper that we might not continue using. We also would like to be more proactive in managing. We would like to utilize automation for expenses. We will want a bookkeeper to perform monthly reconciliations. Existing bookkeeper has QB Desktop. Costs are going up again. We are thinking of getting QB online and providing access to bookkeeper and accountant Basically, we are looking to have a two hour call to discuss our current situation and to receive a recommendation on how to proceed. We aren’t proficient in bookkeeping or accounting software and will be asking a lot of questions.
title: Accounting bookkeeping strategy consultation

description: I have two very small businesses that need bookkeeping services. Would prefer someone local on Pacific Time. Here are a few questions I have for you: What experience and certifications do you have? Do you have experience with businesses in my industry? Media agency What is the scope of the services you offer? What accounting software are you proficient in? How will you handle catching up on neglected bookkeeping? How often will you communicate with me? How will you provide reports? How do you ensure the security and confidentiality of my financial information? Can you assist with tax preparation or do I need a separate accountant? What is your fee structure? Can you provide references?

description: We are seeking a Home Health Care Expert blogger who is CURRENTLY WORKING IN A HOME HEALTH AGENCY, preferably in an agency as either an admin, manager, agency owner, or director of nursing, to serve as a contributor to our blog/content writing team. The ideal person has 10+ years of experience in the Home Health Care industry, as well as experience at blogging, writing, developing content, white papers, and contributing articles to industry publications, blogs, and other online and offline assets/activities. Hosting or being featured as a contributor or panelist in home health or homecare webinars is a plus, as is SEO knowledge. Our Ideal candidate is someone who has worked in home health care management & and administration (wouldn't hurt if they are currently an expert caregiver or director of nursing), and is skilled in developing and presenting content and thought leadership materials. Added bonus if you are knowledgeable of home health software and/or the home health software industry. Desired experience: 1. Has written articles in major or online home health publications, blogs, etc 2. Not required, but preference will be given to those who have been a part of or hosted/created webinars and thought leadership meetings on or offline on homecare an home health topics 3. Has written white papers and blogs, as well as other web content 4. Has an understanding of home health care as a business, and stays abreast of current trends, regulations, and homecare industry infrastructure. 5. Has published or online examples of the works mentioned in 1-4 6. Is a strong writer of reader-friendly and SEO-optimized content without the use of AI platforms for writing. We are looking to establish a perpetual possibly long-term relationship with such a homecare industry expert, to add to our current small team of homecare blog writers.
title: Home Health Care EXPERT blogger

description: About Highrise: Highrise’s mission is to bring leadership development training to growth-minded professionals in fast-paced industries. Highrise is looking to add a Member Experience Advisor to our growing team who will be responsible for business development with potential members. You will start at approximately 10 hours per week during the onboarding period and have the opportunity to ramp to 40. We do require a minimum of 20 hours per week. Please note, this role includes an hourly base rate in addition to compensation linked to performance (commission). This role is an independent contractor role (1099). As a member experience advisor at Highrise, you will be responsible for: Using prospecting strategies to lead initial outreach to prospects such as cold calling, cold emailing, cold LinkedIn outreach, etc. Identify the needs and challenges of the prospective customer. Determine the prospect's interest in Highrise. Schedule and conduct discovery meetings for prospective members of the community You will be responsible for and measured against quotas and sales goals. As mentioned above, this role is a contractor position (1099). A successful candidate will have the following skills and experience: Direct client-facing responsibilities with accountability to sales and engagement metrics. A comfort level and experience with cold outreach – this includes cold emailing, cold calling, etc. High energy & proactive attitude. Willingness to learn and contribute to a team atmosphere. Proficiency in using modern software tools utilized in sales, e.g., Google Suite, Airtable, Hubspot, Apollo, etc. An interest in community building and leadership development/training. Demonstrated autonomy to work independently in a 100% remote environment. Start at about 5-10 hours per week for the first 6-8 weeks, which includes training. We are a completely remote team and the hours themselves are flexible. Compensation: Target hourly compensation is $55/hour.
title: Member Experience Advisor (Sales)

description: Powered by in-house technology, TopView Global creates one-of-a-kind experiences by land and sea for tourists and locals around the world, and builds top notch software solutions that simplify adventure seeking and experience management. We currently operate in NYC, Philadelphia, Washington, DC, Houston, Atlanta, and London; and are looking to expand to Boston, Miami, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Paris, Rome, Barcelona, Dubai, Istanbul and many others in the next few years. We have experienced rapid vertical and horizontal expansion over the past decade. As a Launch Liaison, you will play a crucial role in the successful launch of our Tea Around Town business unit in New Orleans. You will be responsible for assisting with various administrative tasks, including liaising with government agencies to ensure compliance with local regulations. Key Responsibilities: Regulatory Compliance: Work closely with our C-suite to gather necessary documentation and information. File required paperwork with relevant government agencies, such as the Louisiana Department of Motor Vehicles and the City of New Orleans. Stay up-to-date on local regulations and ensure compliance with all applicable laws.\ Qualifications: Required: New Orleans residency Valid Louisiana Driver's License Preferred: Experience in administrative or operations roles Familiarity with local government regulations Strong organizational and time management skills Attention to detail Position Details: Start Date: Immediate Hours per Week: 3-4 Pay Rate: $25/hr Duration: Until early January, with potential for a full-time role post-launch If you are a detail-oriented individual with a strong understanding of local regulations and a passion for the hospitality industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
title: Launch Liaison

Each module pays differently due to the time. The platforms 80% there. EST 2 months of work to launch. I've been fighting to the death to bring this to life. $200k investment from 5. $0 left. Lets talk? Thanks
title: Full stack to bring MVP to launch. Short sprint ahead

description: I have a small business that provides educational training for early years teachers (those teaching kids 2-7 years old) ... (but I am actually formally a college-educated finance major with experience in corporate finance & accounting) I sell digital courses to teachers and parents, but very limited in the UK. I registered for VAT tax and have at times had sales that required a VAT payment, but mostly have to file NIL returns. The UK now requires a digital submission with a link through your actual accounting software. This feels like a lot of work given I usually have a NIL return, but I need help as I have a deadline within two days and I need to get this filed. Someone please help me!!
title: US digital seller to UK need to sort out VAT payments

description: NY Law Firm seeks bookkeepers in the following skill areas to assist our team. We have 3 part time positions available. Accounting Positions: 3 Positions available: 1. Part-Time Accounts Payable (AP) Specialist Description: We are seeking a detail-oriented Accounts Payable Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis. The ideal candidate will manage the full-cycle accounts payable process, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and timely processing of invoices. Responsibilities: • Review and verify invoices for accuracy and compliance with company policies. • Process payments to vendors and suppliers promptly. • Reconcile accounts payable transactions and resolve discrepancies. • Maintain an organized filing system for invoices and payment records. • Communicate with vendors regarding payment status and inquiries. • Generate reports and summaries of AP activity as needed. Qualifications: • Proven experience in accounts payable. • Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Caretlegal (Zola Suite). • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. • Familiarity with bookkeeping principles. Hours: Flexible, part-time schedule. 2. Part-Time Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist Description: We are seeking a proactive Accounts Receivable Specialist to handle billing, follow-ups, and payment processing. The ideal candidate will ensure timely collection of unpaid invoices while maintaining accurate financial records. Responsibilities: • Generate and send invoices to clients promptly. • Follow up on unpaid invoices via email, phone, or other communication channels. • Enter receipts of payment into the accounting system accurately. • Monitor accounts for payment trends and flag potential issues. • Resolve payment discrepancies and customer inquiries efficiently. • Prepare AR aging reports and provide updates to management. • Maintain organized records of billing and collections activities. Qualifications: • Proven experience in accounts receivable or a similar role. • Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Carelegal (ZolaSuite). • Strong communication and follow-up skills. • Highly detail-oriented and organized. • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. Hours: Flexible, part-time schedule. 3. Part-Time Trust Account Manager (Collection Trust Account) Description: We are seeking a meticulous Trust Account Manager to manage and reconcile our collection trust account. The ideal candidate will ensure compliance with legal and regulatory standards while maintaining accurate financial records. Responsibilities: • Manage and oversee the collection trust account operations. • Reconcile trust account transactions regularly. • Ensure all deposits and disbursements are recorded accurately. • Prepare monthly trust account reports and audits. • Maintain compliance with trust account regulations. • Proficiency in software (e.g., Simplicity Collect, Caretlegal (Zola Suite). • Communicate with clients regarding account activities, as needed. Qualifications: • Proven experience managing trust accounts, preferably in collections or legal settings. • Proficiency in trust accounting software. • Thorough understanding of trust account compliance requirements. • Strong analytical and reconciliation skills. • Detail-oriented and highly reliable. Hours: Flexible, part-time schedule.
title: Bookkeeping

description: Experienced Bookkeeper/Accountant - Must be a CPA or EA - (NY). Our company is currently seeking a Full-Time Bookkeeper who is a CPA or EA to join our team! Our firm provides all inclusive accounting services to business owners so you will be responsible for preparing and examining financial records for our clients with a forward thinking proactive mind-set. We are a fast-paced environment and are looking for someone to jump in and have a front facing relationship with our amazing clients. Responsibilities: - Reconcile Bank and credit card statements monthly - Review financials to be able to indicate and mistakes and make the right corrections - Know how to assess a profit and loss and balance sheet - Make appropriate payroll and tax entries if needed - Experience with paypal, stripe and amazon is a plus. - Help out with cleaning up the books and catching up the books for several months or years. Qualifications: - Previous experience in accounting, finance, or other related fields - Ability to prioritize and multitask - Must know Quickbooks Online and Quick books Desktop - Must have 5+ years of experience in accounting - Strong organizational skills - Deadline and detail-oriented We are looking for someone to be available as soon as possible and someone who can work 40 hrs per week M-F 10am to 6pm EST, and is ok with tax season hours of 50-55hrs per week mandatory.
title: Experienced Bookkeeper/Accountant - Must be a CPA or EA (NY)

description: We need a Jira / Confluence Coach who knows Scrum. I consult with a small manufacturing company building automated sorting, slicing, stacking, and bagging machines for commercial baking. The team doesn't know what it doesn't know, and it would be great to have an expert coach to help the team reach the next level. Here is our website. https://lenexamc.com I have built a lot of software, and I have been a CTO and senior product Manager. Jira is brilliant for manufacturing.
title: Jira & Confluence Guru

description: About Us We are Apparatus, an accounting firm that provides specialized bookkeeping and financial management services to construction businesses. We've developed a proprietary system called the Precision Bookkeeping Formula™, which guides our clients through various stages of financial optimization. (link removed) Project Description We're seeking an experienced AI consultant to help us identify and assess opportunities to integrate AI tools into our current business processes. The goal is to enhance our efficiency, accuracy, and client service quality. Key Responsibilities 1. Review our current Precision Bookkeeping Formula™ stages and processes 2. Identify areas where AI can be effectively implemented 3. Suggest specific AI tools or technologies that could be integrated into our workflow 4. Provide a cost-benefit analysis for implementing AI solutions 5. Outline potential challenges and solutions for AI integration 6. Create a prioritized roadmap for AI implementation Required Skills and Experience 1. Proven experience in AI consulting, preferably in the finance or accounting sector 2. Strong understanding of various AI technologies and their practical applications 3. Familiarity with accounting processes and financial management 4. Experience in project management and creating implementation roadmaps 5. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills 6. Strong communication skills, ability to explain complex concepts in simple terms Nice to Have 1. Experience with construction industry accounting 2. Knowledge of QuickBooks Online and other popular accounting software 3. Familiarity with construction management systems Project Scope • This is a short-term contract position, estimated at 20-30 hours • Work can be done remotely • Regular check-ins will be required to ensure alignment with our needs How to Apply Please submit your proposal including: 1. Your relevant experience in AI consulting 2. A brief outline of your approach to this project 3. Your hourly rate 4. Estimated time to complete the project 5. Any questions you have about our business or the project We look forward to working with an innovative AI consultant to help take our services to the next level!
title: AI Consultant Needed for Accounting Firm Specializing in Construction Industry

description: Hospitality client transforming a vineyard into a farm to table restaurant and resort. Looking for experienced user in 3D architectural visualization software, specifically 3D CAD, to produce (a) produce blueprints of the property and structures (measurements and other required inputs will be provided) (b) transform blueprints into a “live” virtual 3D model. The 3D visual model of the structure will be used to plan, modify and execute different phases of this project.
title: Experienced user in 3D architectural visualization software needed

description: =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-= :: ABOUT US :: We're a tech startup at the intersection of Fintech & Business Brokerage: Reinventing the way people buy & sell "Main Street" Companies to help make exits + acquisitions 10x easier. We're in the process of building out a revolutionary software, which will include a private marketplace of the best businesses for sale, plus deal facilitation tools that will streamline complex research & data tasks down to just a few clicks. Our goal is disrupting the $150B+ / yr industry of Main Street Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) through a strategic combination of high-tech and high-touch. =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-= :: WHAT WE ARE SEEKING :: We are looking to add a proven Telemarketer to the Team, to reach out to Business Owners to see who might be a fit to sell their company. Our Telemarketing process is highly structured; you'll be: • Calling Lists we provide. • Following proven Scripts we created. • Using our provided Phone Systems. • Capturing Lead Data into our CRM (HubSpot). We've run similar campaigns for 10,000+ hours with other Telemarketers, so you'll be stepping into a very organized & systematic role to start. However, there is also room for growth & flexibility over time. This role can potentially evolve into more of a Sales Development Representative (SDR) function: • Performing Lead Follow Up & Pre-Qualification • Booking Appointments for Our Senior M&A Advisors • Potentially Even Building Your Own Pipeline (via non-Telemarketing channels) HOWEVER, the most important function & skillset you need to possess is as a dedicated, consistent Telemarketer. =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-= :: SKILLS YOU POSSESS :: We are looking for Intermediate to Expert level Telemarketers: People who have a proven track record on the dialer. Ideally, you have experience doing Telemarketing in the Business Broker / M&A / Private Equity space. If not, experience in Commercial Real Estate, Real Estate Investing, or even B2B Sales might be enough to make you competitive as a candidate. We are only looking for people of the utmost integrity: This is an industry where Clients and colleagues have long memories. We take integrity very seriously at our company, and you need to be a fit there --- at least as much as a fit on the core Telemarketing skills. We are looking for Telemarketers who are: • Consistent • Persistent • Dedicated • Dependable • Honest • Polite • Courteous • Timely • Organized If this sounds like a fit, we would love to have a further discussion. With this role, you will have potential for: ◘ ADVANCEMENT (to more senior roles) ◘ BONUSES (tied to successful deals and/or opportunities) ◘ CONNECTIONS (you will be learning the M&A game w/ some of the best) We look forward to meeting you & to hiring the best candidate(s)!
title: B2B Telemarketing & Inside Sales :: M&A / Business Broker Space [SDR / BDR type role]
